com.mindfusion.common

Class DateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.common.DateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DateTime>

    public final class DateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<DateTime>
    Immutable representation of date and time. This implementation provides more sophisticated wrapper around the date & time API of Java.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DateTime MaxValue
      Represents the largest possible value of DateTime.
      static DateTime MinValue
      Represents the smallest possible value of DateTime.

      • addTicks

        public DateTime addTicks(long value)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Returns a new DateTime that adds the specified number of ticks to this instance.
        Parameters:
        value - A number ticks. The value parameter can be positive or negative.
        Returns:
        A DateTime whose value is the sum of the date and time represented by this instance and the time represented by value.

      • addMilliseconds

        public DateTime addMilliseconds(double value)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Returns a new DateTime that adds the specified number of milliseconds to this instance.
        Parameters:
        value - A number of whole and fractional milliseconds. The value parameter can be negative or positive. Note that this value is rounded to the nearest integer.
        Returns:
        A DateTime whose value is the sum of the date and time represented by this instance and the number of milliseconds represented by value.

      • op_Subtraction

        public static Duration op_Subtraction(DateTime d1,
                                      DateTime d2)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Subtracts a specified date and time from another specified date and time and returns a time interval.
        Parameters:
        d1 - A DateTime (the minuend).
        d2 - A DateTime (the subtrahend).
        Returns:
        A Duration that is the time interval between d1 and d2; that is, d1 minus d2.

      • op_Addition

        public static DateTime op_Addition(DateTime d,
                                   Duration t)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Adds a specified time interval to a specified date and time, yielding a new date and time.
        Parameters:
        d - A DateTime.
        t - A Duration.
        Returns:
        A DateTime that is the sum of the values of d and t.

      • op_Subtraction

        public static DateTime op_Subtraction(DateTime d,
                                      Duration t)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Subtracts a specified time interval from a specified date and time and returns a new date and time.
        Parameters:
        d - A DateTime.
        t - A Duration.
        Returns:
        A DateTime whose value is the value of d minus the value of t.

                                    DateTime d2)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Determines whether two specified instances of DateTime are not equal.
        Parameters:
        d1 - A DateTime.
        d2 - A DateTime.
        Returns:
        true if d1 and d2 do not represent the same date and time or are both null; otherwise, false.

      • today

        public static DateTime today()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets a DateTime object that represents the current date in the default time one and locale.
        Returns:

      • daysInMonth

        public static int daysInMonth(int year,
                              int month)
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Returns the number of days in the specified month and year.
        Parameters:
        year - The year.
        month - The month (a number ranging from 1 to 12).
        Returns:
        The number of days in month for the specified year. For example, if month equals 2 for February, the return value is 28 or 29 depending upon whether year is a leap year.

      • getWeekOfYear

        Returns:
        The week number of the specified date.

      • getTicks

        public long getTicks()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets the total number of ticks in this instance.
        Returns:
        The number of ticks that represent the date and time of this instance. The value is between DateTime.MinValue and DateTime.MaxValue.

      • getDate

        public DateTime getDate()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets the date component of this instance.
        Returns:
        A new DateTime with the same date as this instance, and the time value set to 12:00:00 midnight (00:00:00).

      • getTimeOfDay

        public Duration getTimeOfDay()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets the time of the day of this instance.
        Returns:
        A Duration that represents the fraction of the day that has elapsed since midnight.

      • getDayOfWeek

        public DayOfWeek getDayOfWeek()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets the day of the week represented by this instance.
        Returns:
        One of the DayOfWeek constants.

      • getDayOfYear

        public int getDayOfYear()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets the day of the year represented by this instance.
        Returns:
        The day of the year, expressed as a value between 1 and 366.

      • isUtcTime

        public boolean isUtcTime()
        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets a value indicating whether the time represented by this instance is a UTC time.
        Returns:
        true if the current time represents a UTC time; otherwise, false.

      • isLocalTime

        Description copied from class: DateTime
        Gets a value indicating whether the time represented by this instance is a local time.
        Returns:
        true if the current time represents a local time; otherwise, false.
